Cleared when the key is released or at end of each frame if key is released. 1477 1478 // Routing policies for Shortcut() + low-level SetShortcutRouting() 1479 // - The general idea is that several callers register interest in a shortcut, and only one owner gets it. 1480 // Parent -> call Shortcut(Ctrl+S) // When Parent is focused, Parent gets the shortcut. 1481 // Child1 -> call Shortcut(Ctrl+S) // When Child1 is focused, Child1 gets the shortcut (Child1 overrides Parent shortcuts) 1482 // Child2 -> no call // When Child2 is focused, Parent gets the shortcut. 1483 // The whole system is order independent, so if Child1 does it calls before Parent results will be identical. 1484 // This is an important property as it facilitate working with foreign code or larger codebase. 1485 // - Visualize registered routes in 'Metrics->Inputs' and submitted routes in 'Debug Log->InputRouting'. 1486 // - When a policy (except for _RouteAlways *) is set, Shortcut() will register itself with SetShortcutRouting(), 1487 // allowing the system to decide where to route the input among other route-aware calls. 1488 // (* Using ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways is roughly equivalent to calling IsKeyChordPressed(key)). 1489 // - Shortcut() uses ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused by default. Meaning that a Shortcut() call will register 1490 // a route and only succeed when parent window is in the focus-stack and if no-one with a higher priority 1491 // is claiming the same shortcut. 1492 // - You can chain two unrelated windows in the focus stack using SetWindowParentWindowForFocusRoute(). 1493 // - Priorities: GlobalHigh > Focused (when owner is active item) > Global > Focused (when focused window) > GlobalLow. 1494 // - Can select only 1 policy among all available. 1495 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused = 1 << 12, // (Default) Honor focus route: Accept inputs if window is in focus stack. Deep-most focused window takes inputs. ActiveId takes inputs over deep-most focused window. 1496 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalLow = 1 << 13, // Register route globally (lowest priority: unless a focused window or active item registered the route) -> recommended Global priority IF you need a Global priority. 1497 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal = 1 << 14, // Register route globally (medium priority: unless an active item registered the route, e.g. CTRL+A registered by InputText will take priority over this). 1498 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh = 1 << 15, // Register route globally (higher priority: unlikely you need to use that: will interfere with every active items, e.g. CTRL+A registered by InputText will be overriden by this) 1499 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways = 1 << 16, // Do not register route, poll keys directly. 1500 // Routing polices: extra options 1501 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused= 1 << 17, // Global routes will not be applied if underlying background/void is focused (== no Dear ImGui windows are focused). Useful for overlay applications. 1502 1503 // [Internal] Mask of which function support which flags 1504 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateDefault | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavMove | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavTweak, 1505 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilRelease | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChange | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChangeFromNone | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilOtherKeyPress, 1506 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilMask_, 1507 ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_CondHovered | ImGuiInputFlags_CondActive, 1508 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalLow | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobalHigh, // _Always not part of this! 1509 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsKeyPressed = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_, 1510 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsMouseClicked = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat, 1511 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByShortcut = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused, 1512 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetKeyOwner = ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame | ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease, 1513 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetItemKeyOwner = ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetKeyOwner | ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_, 1514 }; Activation is queued and processed on the next frame when the item is encountered again. 3419 3420 // Inputs 3421 // FIXME: Eventually we should aim to move e.g. IsActiveIdUsingKey() into IsKeyXXX functions. 3422 inline bool IsNamedKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; } 3423 inline bool IsNamedKeyOrModKey(ImGuiKey key) { return (key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END) || key == ImGuiMod_Ctrl || key == ImGuiMod_Shift || key == ImGuiMod_Alt || key == ImGuiMod_Super || key == ImGuiMod_Shortcut; } 3424 inline bool IsLegacyKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; } 3425 inline bool IsKeyboardKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_Keyboard_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Keyboard_END; } 3426 inline bool IsGamepadKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_Gamepad_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Gamepad_END; } 3427 inline bool IsMouseKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_Mouse_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Mouse_END; } 3428 inline bool IsAliasKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_Aliases_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Aliases_END; } 3429 inline bool IsModKey(ImGuiKey key) { return key >= ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl && key <= ImGuiKey_RightSuper; } 3430 ImGuiKeyChord FixupKeyChord(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiKeyChord key_chord); 3431 inline ImGuiKey ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiKey key) 3432 { 3433 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx; 3434 if (key == ImGuiMod_Ctrl) return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl; 3435 if (key == ImGuiMod_Shift) return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModShift; 3436 if (key == ImGuiMod_Alt) return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModAlt; 3437 if (key == ImGuiMod_Super) return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper; 3438 if (key == ImGuiMod_Shortcut) return (g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors ? ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper : ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl); 3439 return key; 3440 } 3441 3442 IMGUI_API ImGuiKeyData* GetKeyData(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiKey key); 3443 inline ImGuiKeyData* GetKeyData(ImGuiKey key) { ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui; return GetKeyData(&g, key); } 3444 IMGUI_API const char* GetKeyChordName(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord); 3445 inline ImGuiKey MouseButtonToKey(ImGuiMouseButton button) { IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT); return (ImGuiKey)(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft + button); } 3446 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold = -1.0f); 3447 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey key_left, ImGuiKey key_right, ImGuiKey key_up, ImGuiKey key_down); 3448 IMGUI_API float GetNavTweakPressedAmount(ImGuiAxis axis); 3449 IMGUI_API int CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate); 3450 IMGUI_API void GetTypematicRepeatRate(ImGuiInputFlags flags, float* repeat_delay, float* repeat_rate); 3451 IMGUI_API void TeleportMousePos(const ImVec2& pos); 3452 IMGUI_API void SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys(); 3453 inline bool IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir dir) { ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui; return (g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask & (1 << dir)) != 0; } 3454 3455 // [EXPERIMENTAL] Low-Level: Key/Input Ownership 3456 // - The idea is that instead of "eating" a given input, we can link to an owner id. 3457 // - Ownership is most often claimed as a result of reacting to a press/down event (but occasionally may be claimed ahead). 3458 // - Input queries can then read input by specifying ImGuiKeyOwner_Any (== 0), ImGuiKeyOwner_None (== -1) or a custom ID. 3459 // - Legacy input queries (without specifying an owner or _Any or _None) are equivalent to using ImGuiKeyOwner_Any (== 0). 3460 // - Input ownership is automatically released on the frame after a key is released. Therefore: 3461 // - for ownership registration happening as a result of a down/press event, the SetKeyOwner() call may be done once (common case). 3462 // - for ownership registration happening ahead of a down/press event, the SetKeyOwner() call needs to be made every frame (happens if e.g. claiming ownership on hover). 3463 // - SetItemKeyOwner() is a shortcut for common simple case. A custom widget will probably want to call SetKeyOwner() multiple times directly based on its interaction state. 3464 // - This is marked experimental because not all widgets are fully honoring the Set/Test idioms. We will need to move forward step by step. 3465 // Please open a GitHub Issue to submit your usage scenario or if there's a use case you need solved. 3466 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key); 3467 IMGUI_API void SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); 3468 IMGUI_API void SetKeyOwnersForKeyChord(ImGuiKeyChord key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); 3469 IMGUI_API void SetItemKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); // Set key owner to last item if it is hovered or active. Equivalent to 'if (IsItemHovered() || IsItemActive()) { SetKeyOwner(key, GetItemID());'. 3470 IMGUI_API bool TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id); // Test that key is either not owned, either owned by 'owner_id' 3471 inline ImGuiKeyOwnerData* GetKeyOwnerData(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiKey key) { if (key & ImGuiMod_Mask_) key = ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(ctx, key); IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKey(key)); return &ctx->KeysOwnerData[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN]; } 3472 3473 // [EXPERIMENTAL] High-Level: Input Access functions w/ support for Key/Input Ownership 3474 // - Important: legacy IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey, bool repeat=true) _DEFAULTS_ to repeat, new IsKeyPressed() requires _EXPLICIT_ ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat flag. 3475 // - Expected to be later promoted to public API, the prototypes are designed to replace existing ones (since owner_id can default to Any == 0) 3476 // - Specifying a value for 'ImGuiID owner' will test that EITHER the key is NOT owned (UNLESS locked), EITHER the key is owned by 'owner'. 3477 // Legacy functions use ImGuiKeyOwner_Any meaning that they typically ignore ownership, unless a call to SetKeyOwner() explicitly used ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame or ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease. 3478 // - Binding generators may want to ignore those for now, or suffix them with Ex() until we decide if this gets moved into public API. 3479 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id); 3480 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); // Important: when transitioning from old to new IsKeyPressed(): old API has "bool repeat = true", so would default to repeat. New API requiress explicit ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat. 3481 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id); 3482 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id); 3483 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); 3484 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id); 3485 IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id); 3486 3487 // [EXPERIMENTAL] Shortcut Routing 3488 // - ImGuiKeyChord = a ImGuiKey optionally OR-red with ImGuiMod_Alt/ImGuiMod_Ctrl/ImGuiMod_Shift/ImGuiMod_Super. 3489 // ImGuiKey_C (accepted by functions taking ImGuiKey or ImGuiKeyChord) 3490 // ImGuiKey_C | ImGuiMod_Ctrl (accepted by functions taking ImGuiKeyChord) 3491 // ONLY ImGuiMod_XXX values are legal to 'OR' with an ImGuiKey. You CANNOT 'OR' two ImGuiKey values. 3492 // - When using one of the routing flags (e.g. ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused): routes requested ahead of time given a chord (key + modifiers) and a routing policy. 3493 // - Routes are resolved during NewFrame(): if keyboard modifiers are matching current ones: SetKeyOwner() is called + route is granted for the frame. 3494 // - Route is granted to a single owner. When multiple requests are made we have policies to select the winning route. 3495 // - Multiple read sites may use the same owner id and will all get the granted route. 3496 // - For routing: when owner_id is 0 we use the current Focus Scope ID as a default owner in order to identify our location. 3497 // - TL;DR; 3498 // - IsKeyChordPressed() compares mods + call IsKeyPressed() -> function has no side-effect. 3499 // - Shortcut() submits a route then if currently can be routed calls IsKeyChordPressed() -> function has (desirable) side-effects. 3500 IMGUI_API bool IsKeyChordPressed(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0); The initial node becomes a parent node. 3544 // - If you intend to split the node immediately after creation using DockBuilderSplitNode(), make sure 3545 // to call DockBuilderSetNodeSize() beforehand.
